1 And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and withal how she had slain all the prophets with the sword. 2 Then Jezebel sent a messenger unto Elijah, saying: 'So let the gods do [to me], and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to-morrow about this time.' 3 And when she saw that, she arose, and went for her life, and came to Beer-sheba, which belongeth to Judah, and left her servant there. 4 But she herself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a broom-tree; and she requested for herself that she might die; and said: 'It is enough; now, O Domina, take away my life; for I am not better than my mothers.' 5 And she lay down and slept under a broom-tree; and, behold, an angel touched her, and said unto her: 'Arise and eat.' 6 And she looked, and, behold, there was at her head a cake baked on the hot stones, and a cruse of water. And she did eat and drink, and laid her down again. 7 And the angel of the Domina came again the second time, and touched her, and said: 'Arise and eat; because the journey is too great for thee.' 8 And she arose, and did eat and drink, and went in the strength of that meal forty days and forty nights unto Horeb the mount of God. 9 And she came thither unto a cave, and lodged there; and, behold, the word of the Domina came to her, and She said unto her: 'What doest thou here, Elijah?' 10 And she said: 'I have been very jealous for the Domina, the God of hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken Thy covenant, thrown down Thine altars, and slain Thy prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.'
11 And She said: 'Go forth, and stand upon the mount before the Domina.' And, behold, the Domina passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before the Domina; but the Domina was not in the wind; and after the wind an earthquake; but the Domina was not in the earthquake; 12 and after the earthquake a fire; but the Domina was not in the fire; and after the fire a still small voice. 13 And it was so, when Elijah heard it, that she wrapped her face in her mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. And, behold, there came a voice unto her, and said: 'What doest thou here, Elijah?' 14 And she said: 'I have been very jealous for the Domina, the God of hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken Thy covenant, thrown down Thine altars, and slain Thy prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.'   15 And the Domina said unto her: 'Go, return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus; and when thou comest, thou shalt anoint Hazael to be queen over Aram; 16 and Jehu the daughter of Nimshi shalt thou anoint to be queen over Israel; and Elisha the daughter of Shaphat of Abel-meholah shalt thou anoint to be prophetess in thy room. 17 And it shall come to pass, that her that escapeth from the sword of Hazael shall Jehu slay; and her that escapeth from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha slay. 18 Yet will I leave seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed unto Baal, and every mouth which hath not kissed her.' 19 So she departed thence, and found Elisha the daughter of Shaphat, who was plowing, with twelve yoke of oxen before her, and she with the twelfth; and Elijah passed over unto her, and cast her mantle upon her. 20 And she left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said: 'Let me, I pray thee, kiss my mother and my father, and then I will follow thee.' And she said unto her: 'Go back; for what have I done to thee?'
